article_title: Rwanda's Bank of Kigali reports rise in third-quarter profit
article_text:
KIGALI Nov 27 Rwanda's Bank of Kigali reported a rise in third-quarter pretax profit to 5.3 billion Rwandan francs ($7.8 million) from 4.7 billion francs a year ago.

Net interest income at the bank, the largest by assets in the east African country, climbed to 9.4 billion francs in the three-month period to September, up from 8.9 billion francs in the same period of 2013.

Net fees and commissions slipped to 2.2 billion francs from 2.4 billion francs. (1 US dollar = 685.0000 Rwandan franc) (Reporting by Clement Uwiringiyimana; Editing by Edmund Blair and Jane Merriman)

article_summary:
KIGALI Nov 27 Rwanda's Bank of Kigali reported a rise in third-quarter pretax profit to 5.3 billion Rwandan francs ($7.8 million) from 4.7 billion francs a year ago.
Net fees and commissions slipped to 2.2 billion francs from 2.4 billion francs.
Net interest income at the bank, the largest by assets in the east African country, climbed to 9.4 billion francs in the three-month period to September, up from 8.9 billion francs in the same period of 2013.
(1 US dollar = 685.0000 Rwandan franc) (Reporting by Clement Uwiringiyimana; Editing by Edmund Blair and Jane Merriman)
